sentences.en: But it contained one very interesting piece of data: in 2008, for the first time in sixteen years, the finance and insurance industry shrank.
sentences.cn: 但是，这份报告里有一项非常耐人寻味的数据：在2008年，金融保险业出现近十六年来的首次萎缩。

sentences.en: Canada's economy shrank at an annual rate of 5.4% in the first quarter, its biggest decline since 1991, but less than economists had feared.
sentences.cn: 加拿大经济第一季度以每年5.4%的速度萎缩。这是自1991年以来最大的萎缩，但是没有经济学家害怕的严重。

sentences.en: He shrank back ( in shame , horror , etc. ).
Janet made her new dress from cheap cloth, and when she washed it , It'shrank and was too small. Live and learn.
sentences.cn: 詹妮特用便宜布料做了一件新衣, 洗后缩得很小, 真是吃一堑,长一智.

sentences.en: Janet made her new dress from cheap cloth, and when she washed it, it shrank and was too small.Live and learn.
sentences.cn: 詹妮特用便宜布料做了一件新衣，洗后缩得很小，真是吃一堑，长一智。

sentences.en: Mr. Hyde shrank back with a hissing intake of the breath.
sentences.cn: 海德先生猛然朝后一缩,倒抽了一口凉气.

sentences.en: My sweater shrank in the wash.
Scarlett glared at her and Prissy shrank back, trying to pull loose.
sentences.cn: 思嘉狠狠地瞅着她,吓得百里茜直往后退, 准备溜走.

sentences.en: She shrank back with an involuntary gasp.
sentences.cn: 她不由得倒抽了口冷气，往后退了退。

sentences.en: She shrank from touching him as she harnessed him.
sentences.cn: 至于脊背,那就只是一大片斑斑点点的伤痕罢了.

sentences.en: Siegfried cringed and shrank against the wall.
sentences.cn: 西格弗里德畏缩了，退避到墙根。

sentences.en: The blackman shrank from any direct participation in politics.
sentences.cn: 这位黑人回避直接插足政治.

sentences.en: The dog shrank from the whip.
The economy shrank and inflation zoomed.
sentences.cn: 经济萎缩，通货膨胀加剧。

sentences.en: The physician who lives in the Chicago area invested heavily in stocks, only to cringe as the value of his portfolio shrank 42% over the last decade.
sentences.cn: 这位医生住在芝加哥地区，将大量投资投入到股票上，只有在他的投资价值于过去十年缩水42%的事实才令他退缩。

sentences.en: The sensitive clergyman shrank, with nervous dread, from the light missile.
sentences.cn: 那敏感的牧师怀着神经质的恐惧, 将身子一缩, 躲开了那轻飘的飞弹.

sentences.en: Winston shrank back upon the bed.

trans.tran_cn: 收缩( shrink的过去式 )，（使）缩水，退缩，畏缩
trans.tran_en: to become smaller, or to make something smaller, through the effects of heat or water
